name: CreateRepoFromTemplate
description:
Create a new repository from a template.

Use this tool to create a new GitHub repository using an existing repository template. Specify the template by providing the template owner's and repository's names. Ensure the template is accessible and the necessary OAuth scopes are authorized. This tool is useful when needing to quickly start a new project with predefined settings and structure.

parameters.name: template_repository_owner
parameters.description: Username or organization name that owns the template repository.

parameters.name: template_repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository template to use for creating the new repository.

parameters.name: new_repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the new repository to be created using the template.

value_schema.description: The name of the new repository.

parameters.name: repository_description
parameters.description: A short description of the new GitHub repository to be created from the template.

value_schema.description: A short description of the new repository.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The organization or user that will own the new repository. Must be a valid organization member if creating under an organization.

value_schema.description: The organization or person who will own the new repository. To create a new repository in an organization, the authenticated user must be a member of the specified organization.

parameters.name: include_all_branches_from_template
parameters.description: Set to true to include files from all branches in the template repository, not just the default branch. Default: false.

value_schema.description: Set to `true` to include the directory structure and files from all branches in the template repository, and not just the default branch. Default: `false`.

parameters.name: create_private_repository
parameters.description: Set to true to create a private repository, or false to create a public one.

value_schema.description: Either `true` to create a new private repository or `false` to create a new public one.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the new repository.

value_schema.description: A short description of the new repository.

parameters.name: include_all_branches
parameters.description: Set to `true` to include the directory structure and files from all branches in the template repository, and not just the default branch. Default: `false`.

value_schema.description: Set to `true` to include the directory structure and files from all branches in the template repository, and not just the default branch. Default: `false`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new repository.

value_schema.description: The name of the new repository.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The organization or person who will own the new repository. To create a new repository in an organization, the authenticated user must be a member of the specified organization.

value_schema.description: The organization or person who will own the new repository. To create a new repository in an organization, the authenticated user must be a member of the specified organization.

parameters.name: private
parameters.description: Either `true` to create a new private repository or `false` to create a new public one.

value_schema.description: Either `true` to create a new private repository or `false` to create a new public one.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
